title: Fear of the Flame: A Christian Historical Fiction of the French Huguenots
description: A clean historical fiction of the French Huguenots during the 16th century.Michel Chevallier has been smuggling tracts by Swiss reformers into France for several years. He returns home to see someone hiding illegal material near his family home. How can he dispose of the material and rescue his family before soldiers arrive to accuse and arrest them? Who is the man hiding the materials? Who has found out about his activities and is trying to trap his family? He seems familiar, but Michel can't place who it is.Michel struggles with the disappointment of a broken relationship and deals with the question of why bad things come to those who serve God. He is forced to face fear such as he has never met in his life. Where is God in the midst of danger and persecution? It is a time of religious war and persecution as the Catholic Guise family and the Huguenot Bourbon family battle for the throne of France.
author: Wilda W. Pingel
